{"blocks":[{"key":"9uamt","text":"Prepare 1% BSA in PBS-CMF and place   – at least 3mL per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"h8ka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epbs0","text":"If suspension cells – centrifuge for   at   to   in a 15mL conical tube, carefully aspirate the supernatant, and resuspend in PBS-CMF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93tgb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"200","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lt31","text":"Dissociate or lift cells to obtain single cell suspension (will vary depending on sample type). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eiugt","text":"It is crucial that cells are properly resuspended in buffer at single cell suspension before labeling. For standard cell types, I recommend straining cells through a 40µm mesh before counting and labeling to prevent heterogeneous labeling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f9d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dve3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5p7d8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b163r","text":"If using Trypsin or similar which is inactivated by the addition of FBS or BSA, rinse the cell suspension with PBS-CMF twice as described in step 4b.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81hm2","text":"Strain single-cell suspension through a 40 µm cell-strainer and count cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aahq3","text":"Repeat step 10 for a total of two wash steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a3nu","text":"Filter cell suspension through a 40 µm cell-strainer and count cells again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8geib","text":"Combine all samples at desired ratio and continue with scRNA-seq procedure according to 10x Genomics instructions for endogenous transcripts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7d7d7","text":"For each lane of 10X, follow the 10X workflow until cDNA amplification (Step 2.2 in the Chromium Single Cell 3ʹ Reagent Kits v3 with Feature Barcode technology for CRISPR Screening protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1q4q9","text":"During post GEM-RT cleanup the aqueous layer will be cloudy due to the higher BSA concentration we use during our post-barcoding rinses. The BSA helps to quench excess LMO barcodes and limit off-target labeling. This does not cause any issues or negatively affect results. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
